Elon Musk is the CEO of SpaceX. He is also the CEO of Tesla, Inc., and the founder of The Boring Company and Neuralink. Musk was born in South Africa in 1971 and moved to Canada when he was 17 years old. He attended Queen's University in Kingston, Ontario, and then transferred to the University of Pennsylvania, where he received an economics degree from the Wharton School and a degree in physics from the College of Arts and Sciences. Musk then moved to California to attend Stanford University, but dropped out after two days to pursue a business career.

Musk co-founded Zip2, a web software company, in 1995. The company was acquired by Compaq for $307 million in 1999. Musk then co-founded X.com, an online financial services company, in 1999. X.com merged with Confinity in 2000 to form PayPal. PayPal was acquired by eBay for $1.5 billion in 2002.

Musk founded SpaceX in 2002 with the goal of reducing space transportation costs and enabling the colonization of Mars. SpaceX has developed the Falcon 9 and Falcon Heavy launch vehicles, the Dragon spacecraft, and the Starlink satellite constellation. SpaceX has also been contracted by NASA to develop the Crew Dragon spacecraft, which will transport astronauts to the International Space Station.

Musk founded Tesla, Inc., in 2003 with the goal of accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. Tesla produces electric cars, solar panels, and energy storage products. Tesla's mission is to "create the most compelling car company of the 21st century by driving the world's transition to electric vehicles."

Musk founded The Boring Company in 2016 with the goal of solving traffic congestion. The Boring Company is developing a system of tunnels that will allow cars to travel at high speeds underground.

Musk founded Neuralink in 2016 with the goal of developing brain-computer interfaces. Neuralink is developing implantable devices that will allow humans to communicate with computers and other devices using their thoughts.

Musk is a controversial figure. He has been criticized for his business practices, his public statements, and his personal life. However, he is also widely admired for his ambition, his vision, and his accomplishments.
